comments: "If n is a triangular number, then so are 9n+1, 25n+3 and 49n+6. (Euler, 1775)." -p. 17. Note that A060544 is the same as 9n+1 when n is triangular and that 9*(n*(n+1)/2)+1 is another formula for it.
references: D. M. Burton, Elementary Number Theory, Allyn and Bacon, Inc. Boston, MA, 1976, pp. 17.
